html: #FlorenceNC safety tips: - STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm. - Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. - If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home. - Have your emergency kit ready!
text:
#FlorenceNC safety tips:
- STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm.
- Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. 
- If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home.
- Have your emergency kit ready!

html: HAPPENING NOW: The House is voting on H. Res. 970, a resolution from myself and @Jim_Jordan to formally compel the DOJ to turn over all remaining documents within 7 days. We are tired of the DOJ giving us the runaround. It's time for Congress to vote and hold them accountable.
text:
HAPPENING NOW: The House is voting on H. Res. 970, a resolution from myself and @Jim_Jordan to formally compel the DOJ to turn over all remaining documents within 7 days.

We are tired of the DOJ giving us the runaround. It's time for Congress to vote and hold them accountable.

html: Yesterday James Comey told @BretBaier he had shared his memos with not one, but three people. He had never disclosed this to Congress. Director Comey has a few more questions he needs to answer. ICYMI: my op-ed from yesterday.https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/op-eds/mark-meadows-james-comey-probably-misled-congress-now-he-must-answer-these-5-questions …
text:
Yesterday James Comey told @BretBaier he had shared his memos with not one, but three people. He had never disclosed this to Congress.

Director Comey has a few more questions he needs to answer. ICYMI: my op-ed from yesterday.https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/op-eds/mark-meadows-james-comey-probably-misled-congress-now-he-must-answer-these-5-questions …

html: Director Comey also claimed to not know for a fact whether the dossier was funded by the Democrats and Hillary Clinton (it was--it is a fact), and then he immediately pivoted to the well-debunked claim that Republicans funded the dossier. Odd.
text: Director Comey also claimed to not know for a fact whether the dossier was funded by the Democrats and Hillary Clinton (it was--it is a fact), and then he immediately pivoted to the well-debunked claim that Republicans funded the dossier. Odd.

html: It's difficult to know where to begin on that Director Comey interview w/ @BretBaier. He just admitted to leaking his memos (with now-classified info) to two more people, in addition his friend. So he shared government property with not one, but three people? What?

html: If anything, this impugns the judgement of Director Comey. He's the one apparently using the media to exaggerate concerns about interactions with the President. He's the one leaking government (and possibly classified) documents to a third party. Come on.
text: If anything, this impugns the judgement of Director Comey. He's the one apparently using the media to exaggerate concerns about interactions with the President. He's the one leaking government (and possibly classified) documents to a third party. Come on.

html: These Comey memos were supposed to implicate President Trump? Really? On page 13 POTUS appears to instruct Director Comey to investigate and find the truth about whether his campaign team did anything wrong. There's nothing in here even approaching 'obstruction of justice.'
text:
These Comey memos were supposed to implicate President Trump? Really? 

On page 13 POTUS appears to instruct Director Comey to investigate and find the truth about whether his campaign team did anything wrong. There's nothing in here even approaching 'obstruction of justice.'

html: Rod Rosenstein prosecuting Andrew McCabe would be asking the Department of Justice to penalize the Department of Justice. This is a textbook conflict of interest. This should be grounds for a special counsel.
text: Rod Rosenstein prosecuting Andrew McCabe would be asking the Department of Justice to penalize the Department of Justice. This is a textbook conflict of interest. This should be grounds for a special counsel.

html: 28 CFR 600.1 is the statute titled: "Grounds for appointing a Special Counsel": 1. Investigation/prosecution of US Attorney’s office would present a conflict of interest for the Department (of Justice) (https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/28/600.1 …)
text:
28 CFR 600.1 is the statute titled: "Grounds for appointing a Special Counsel":

1. Investigation/prosecution of US Attorney’s office would present a conflict of interest for the Department (of Justice) (https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/28/600.1 …)

html: Andrew McCabe lied to his FBI superiors not once. Not twice. Not three times. He lied four times--multiple times under oath. The criminal referral from the IG is the right decision. It's about time we have some accountability for this type of conduct at the Justice Department.
text:
Andrew McCabe lied to his FBI superiors not once. Not twice. Not three times. He lied four times--multiple times under oath.

The criminal referral from the IG is the right decision. It's about time we have some accountability for this type of conduct at the Justice Department.

text:
At what point does all this troubling info become enough? We can appoint a special counsel for a nonsense collusion case (with zero evidence), but we can't do the same for a DOJ that, by now, appears clear-as-day politicized?

It's past time. We need a second special counsel.
